Event.name: Receiving
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Recipient</fen> comes into possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> as a result of the joint action of the <fen>Donor</fen> and the <fen>Recipient</fen>. The Receiving frame like the Giving frame requires that the <fen>Donor</fen> first has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and that following the transfer, the <fen>Donor</fen>no longer has the <fen>Theme</fen> and the <fen>Recipient</fen> does.
<ex><fex name="Recipient">I</fex> <t>recieved</t> <fex name="Theme">a box</fex> <fex name="Donor">from him</fex> <fex name="Means">in the mail</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Recipient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who acts to come into possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Donor
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that changes possession, beginning in the possession of the <fen>Donor</fen> and ending up with the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose_of_donor
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The aim of the <fen>Donor</fen>, which they believe will be accomplished by giving the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>Rural communities <t>received</t> government subsidies<fex name="pur">to ensure their continued viability.</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The act that the <fen>Recipient</fen> performs which brings about their reception of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>She received the package <fex name="mea">by signing her name on the delivery certification</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Recipient</fen> comes into possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>She received the package <fex name="tim">before the month was out</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the Recipient comes into possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Mode_of_transfer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The system whereby the <fen>Theme</fen> travels (literally or metaphorically) so that the <fen>Recipient</fen> comes into possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>I <t>received</t> it <fex name="mod">by e-mail</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Recipient</fen> or <fen>Theme</fen> during the action.
<ex>I didn't expect to <t>receive</t> this steak <fex name="dep">absolutely raw</fex>!</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The character of the <fen>Recipient</fen> which saliently affects the action, or a general description of the action itself.
<ex>He <fex name="man">slyly</fex> <t>received</t> the package without signing for it.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Countertransfer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A good given or a service rendered by the <fen>Recipient</fen>, in return for wich the <fen>Theme</fen> is given to the <fen>Recipient</fen> by the <fen>Donor</fen>.
<ex>Shelley Walker of Washoe County?s Information Technology Department <t>received</t> $100 <fex name="cou">for her suggestion to create an electronic employee evaluation form</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>When the <fen>Theme</fen> is received physically by the <fen>Recipient</fen> from the <fen>Donor</fen>, the <fen>Path</fen> of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen> may be specified.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose_of_theme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>What the <fen>Recipient</fen> intends to do with the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>James Madison Memorial High School <t>received</t> $1,000 <fex name="pot">to purchase instruments for school orchestra and band programs</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A role that the <fen>Theme</fen> is intended to fill by the <fen>Donor</fen>.
<ex>He <t>received</t> the book <fex name="rol">as a gift</fex> from his uncle.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: receive.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to take something that is given

lexUnit.name: accept.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to consciously receive something given

lexUnit.name: receipt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of receiving something or the fact of its being received
